title: Kent School District - Student Rapes and Sexual Assaults - claims and records - Evans, Crave & Lackie - District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Kent School District - Student Rapes and Sexual Assaults - claims and records - Evans, Crave & Lackie - District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 1:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 6 states:

"Katembo v. KSD (Byrd). Mr. Byrd plead guilty to rape of a KSD student. Our attorney is Mick McFarland of Evans, Craven & Lackey. mmcfarland@ecl-law.com. (509) 455-5200. No tort claim to date. But we expect a lawsuit by victim."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Mr. Byrd.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 2:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 6 states:

"DeBarthe v. KSD (DeVeiteo). SA by guest teacher. Our attorney is Mick McFarland of Evans, Craven & Lackey. mmcfarland@ecl-law.com. (509) 455-5200. Opposing counsel Daniel Hannula of Rush, Hannula, Harkins & Kyler PLLC. The matter settled."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding SA by guest teacher.
2. All records regarding a settlement.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 3:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Hernandez-Martinez v. KSD. Sex Assault/Rape case. Our attorney is Mick McFarland. This is settled for $42k, covered by insurance. Awaiting court approval. Plaintiff’s counsel: Herrman Law Group (Tacoma). Plaintiff law firm did not allege WLAD, so received no attorneys fees, etc."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Sex Assault/Rape case.
2. All records regarding a settlement.
3. All records regarding insurance coverage.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 4:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Guzman. Student to student SA. Working with Dawn Greene at Choose Clear. #SE2898- 1 Plaintiff is represented by “My Injury Attorney” and have asked for insurance information. There was a no contact contract in place at Kentwood. There were police reports for domestic violence for situation that did not occur at school. Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Sofia Aparicio. 1-833-877-7070"

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Student to student SA.
2. All records regarding insurance information
3. All records and communications to and from Dawn Greene at Choose Clear.
4. Copies of all police reports.
5. All records and communications to and from  Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Sofia Aparicio. 1-833-877-7070
6. all records #SE2898- 1.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 5:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Menard. Student to student Sex Assault. Working with Dawn Greene at Clear Risk. #S4258. We are gathering records for Clear Risk. Student claims the other student committed multiple sexual assaults while unsupervised on Kentridge school premises between October 21 and February 22. She stated she notified school administrators. She claims that safety plans were not put in place. Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Julie Kline of Schroeter Goldmark Bender. kline@sgb-law.com"

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Student to student Sex Assault.
2. All records and communications to and from Dawn Greene at Choose Clear.
3. All records #S4258.
4. All records and communications to and from Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Julie Kline of Schroeter Goldmark Bender. kline@sgb-law.com

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 6:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 3 states:

"Young v KSD (Konneh) King County Superior Court Case 23-2-24933-0 KNT.  Case assigned to Mick McFarland at Evans, Crave & Lackie, in Spokane and is covered. Plaintiff alleges a KSD bus driver raped an 11 year old child and gave her STD’s.  Case is stayed until the criminal proceeding is concluded.
Konneh is in custody, and has an assigned criminal defense counsel, Mr.  Hammerstad.  We have coordinated several interviews between Hammerstad and our employees on the advice of Mick McFarland at Evans Lackie.  At our request, SIAW hired separate civil defense counsel (Floyd at Floyd Pfluger) for our former employee, which Mick thought might reduce the likelihood of our employee being found liable and foisting off all the judgment on us.  We are following Mick’s advise and cooperating with our insurance carrier, the latter being a condition of coverage.  We are having nascent discussions about a Joint Defense Agreement, which may help us deal with records requests. No agreement has been proposed yet but Mick will go through that with you in my absence, if necessary. Plaintiff’s counsel: Ashon Dennis Washington Law Center, who is very capable but reasonable."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records King County Superior Court Case 23-2-24933-0 KNT.
2. All records regarding several interviews between Hammerstad and our employees.
3. All records regarding SIAW
4. All records regarding our former employee
5. All records regarding insurance carrier
6. All records regarding Joint Defense Agreement
7. All records and communications to and from Plaintiff’s counsel: Ashon Dennis Washington Law Center

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Parents for Change

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of San Diego public records request #24-7002
communications.communication:
City of San Diego ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-7002: Good morning, The records you requested are exempt pursuant to the following Government Code sections: Government Code section 7927.705 [California Penal Code sections 13300-13326] [Criminal History] - With some exceptions, the criminal history of an individual is not releasable under the Public Records Act. California Penal Code sections 13300 through 13326 authorize the release of local summary criminal history information to the subject of the criminal history. Additionally, a local agency shall furnish local summary criminal history information to entities specifically identified by statute when needed through the course of their duties, provided that information is furnished to assist an agency, officer, or official of state or local government, a public utility, or any entity, in fulfilling employment, certification, or licensing duties. The person making the decision to withhold the records is A/Capt. Nichole Robertson. Please see instructions at https://www.sandiego.gov/police/services/faqs/information. Kind regards. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of San Diego.

title: Purchases by Delaware under the 1122 Program (Department of Safety and Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Purchases by Delaware under the 1122 Program (Department of Safety and Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-An itemized list of all purchases of equipment by law enforcement agencies (LEAs) through the 1122 program (10 U.S. Code § 281) from 1994 to 2024. This can be provided by annual purchase requests that are sent to the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) by the state point of contact (SPOC). This can also be provided by collated receipts for purchases by the agencies.

-All 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders submitted by LEAs to the SPOC. According to the 1122 Program Guide, 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders are required to be sent to the SPOC within 30 days of purchase.

-DA Report: total expenditures to the Department of the Army which are reported annually and are releasable. The requested date range of the requested annual reports is 1994 to 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Lillian Mauldin.

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation's Face Recognition System

communications.subject: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Bureau of Criminal Investigation's face recognition system, and 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photos to the Bureau for a search from March 11, 2023 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs or datasets showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If the Bureau maintains this information in an Excel spreadsheet, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: St. Paul Police Department investigation - Seantrell Murdock

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: St. Paul Police Department investigation - Seantrell Murdock
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of 
Suspect Name: Seantrell Murdock
Description/Headline: Lowertown homicide suspect dead after St. Paul police track him to Belle Plaine
Link of the Article: https://kstp.com/kstp-news/top-news/st-paul-police-officers-involved-in-deadly-shooting-in-belle-plaine/
State: Minnesota's
Law Enforcement: St. Paul Police Department

 included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case

Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.
If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Student Directory Information

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Student Directory Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All directory information on all currently enrolled cadets at the Virginia Military Institute. The contact information of enrolled students (including their cell phone numbers and email addresses) is a matter of public record. Under FERPA, it is considered “directory information,” along with other basic information like the student’s email, major, dates of attendance and enrollment status. It is common for entities that want to advertise to students to request this publicly available contact information — everything from apartment complexes, to credit cards, to political candidates and so there is no exemption that will prevent release of this information unless individual cadets specifically sign a statement to have their information “withheld.” Under federal law, directory information is not considered private unless students opt to withhold it from public disclosure.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020
communications.communication:
LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

Via email: publicrecordsrequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Email request

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Email request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am submitting this request under the Mississippi Public Records Act to obtain records related to Suzanne Wallace, an officer at the DeSoto County Sheriff’s Department. My request is as follows:

	1.	All email communications sent to and from Suzanne Wallace during the period from January 1, 2017, to January 31, 2019. This includes any emails related to internal communications within the department as well as communications with external parties such as other law enforcement agencies, state and federal authorities, and private individuals. Please include any attachments to these emails, such as documents, images, or other files.
	2.	All records, write-ups, disciplinary actions, and internal investigations involving Suzanne Wallace for the entire duration of her employment with the DeSoto County Sheriff’s Department, regardless of date. This includes any formal or informal investigations, complaints filed (both internal and external), performance reviews, and any documentation related to disciplinary actions or corrective measures taken.
	3.	All complaints filed against Suzanne Wallace, whether internal (filed by fellow officers or department staff) or external (filed by private citizens or other entities), for the entire duration of her employment with the DeSoto County Sheriff’s Department. Please include the dates, descriptions of the complaints, investigative reports, and outcomes.

If there are any fees associated with processing this request, please inform me of the estimated costs. 

If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific reasons for the denial and cite the applicable exemptions. If any portions of the records are exempt from disclosure, please release any non-exempt portions.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for your response. 

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jay Hunt

title: Last Meal information and receipts for Richard Glossip

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Last Meal information and receipts for Richard Glossip
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Procurement information related to the three “last meals” for the death row inmate Richard Glossip. Detailed requests below.

1. Oklahoma's Institutional Level Purchasing /Procurement Policies

Documents
I would like to see all documented purchasing policies for last meals (see below for specific questions I would like answered.) 
(What is the approval process for last meal choices? 
Is there cost limit per meal? 
How are special, more expensive ingredient approved? 
Does the warden join the prisoner for the last meal, and if so do they also get a meal provided?
- If the meal isn’t prepared onsite, who picks up the meal (for example, at KFC)
- And in this case, does the staff member request reimbursement or do they use a credit card? 
- What is the Expense reimbursement process

2. Specific Meal information for Richard Glossip

Receipts
Records of meals for each of his three meals
 - if made ineernally, detailed ingredient list)
- Cost / Payment information for the meal: kitchen staff time allocated to preparing the meal and grocery costs 
If bought externally
- Physical receipts or scanned copies of receipts  
- Cost / Payment information for any off-site meal purchases (ex; bucket of KFC chicken) and any relevant documentation, including emails associated with the meals

Also, any information regarding the food or meals that Glossip had for his two marriages, including documentation and receipts

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Margot Hanley

states: The oral history of Colonel John William Nocita.

Our office uses the foia@nara.gov address for FOIA and Privacy Act requests
for the NARA's operational records (records created by this agency).

created by or originated in a different agency, but that may have been
transferred to the legal custody of NARA), we are forwarding it by this
email to our Office of Research Services, Motion Picture and Sound

handles requests for the type of records you seek.

title: FBI files: David Burnham

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files: David Burnham
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on David Burnham, an investigative reporter the New York Times. Here is his obituary: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/05/nyregion/david-burnham-dead.html

According to media reports, he was born as David Bright Burnhamon Jan. 24, 1933, in Boston.

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

Sincerely,

J publi

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Mug Shot (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

My name is Catina Washington. I am requesting for a mug shot for inmate 141387/Phillip Fredinburg. He was arrested and released on April 2, 2024. I Pull up the former president, Donald Trump’s and O.J. Simpson’s mug shot, but I can’t pull up his. Please help me in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Catina Washington

title: Privacy Act / Freedom of Information Act (Associate General Counsel (General Law), U.S. Department of Homeland Security [APPEALS])

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I am replying to the letter (Request No. 1646627-000) I received in response to my attached appeal.  I am in search of any information regarding any and all investigations made about me, for the purposes of rectifying any confusion.  I have been stalked and harassed by a wide array of individuals with seemingly endless resources and infinite knowledge about my personal doings.  They have also taken to slandering me in public.  My internet has been constantly tampered with, and things have been found missing from my home.  I have not committed any crime.  I have no reason to believe that I am, nor have I ever been, a threat to national security.  

If it is not any government organization perpetrating these harmful tactics, then I would like any insight on what organization has been allowed to harass me for so many years.  I have been told that the government outsources to services such as “Infra Guard” and others.  Clearly, I have not been arrested for anything in my adult life, and if I am being harassed daily by a government agency, I'd like to know why I am being denied my right to due process.  If it is not a government agency behind it, I'd like any information on what organization has been allowed to get away with violating my privacy and my rights as an American citizen.  

For ten years, I have had coordinated attempts to harass and intimidate me, up to and including people tampering with my phone, turning its flashlights on randomly through no fault of my own, or making calls without my doing.  I've had my phone ring while it was turned off, in front of witnesses.  I've also had people come up to me in the street and tell me to “be careful what I say in my letters”, not to mention more subtle, but all-too frequent attempts to insinuate that they know intimate details of my personal life.  It may be executed by a wide swath of coordinated individuals, but it is a daily occurrence.  In fact, it is almost every time I go outside. I am hereby giving you as much information as I can in the hopes that you can help me rectify this situation.  

It is my hope that I can uncover information about what organization is harassing me, and if it is in fact due to “investigative” status, I'd like to do what I can to clarify that I have never had any intention to commit any crime whatsoever.   I am frankly not competent enough for terrorism, but I am willing to do what it takes to follow the chain of command and put this harassment to a stop.  

Thanks in advance for your consideration.  I declare under penalty or perjury that the above statements are true to the best of my knowledge and understanding.  

Sincerely,

Arvo Zylo



Hello,

I am writing to appeal DHS's determination that I am not entitled to TSDB documents regarding any investigation that persists against me.  I understand that there are claims that my private information being kept from me may be justified under the auspices of “National Security”, but I would like to know why my right to due process is being violated by a wide array of individuals with seemingly ceaseless access to my personal information and an unending budget that could only be funded by a large organization.   I have not committed any crime, and I've been stalked and harassed for (2014-2024) ten years, not simply “investigated”.  Your email implies that I would have access to specific information that I am not privy to.  I am asking for data on any and all elements of investigation status, or history on me, including actions taken against me.  

Please find my initial request below, followed by the denial letter that I was told to include in my appeal.   I am stating under penalty or perjury that the statements herein are true to the best of my knowledge and understanding.  

Arvo Zylo


RE: PRIVACY ACT REQUEST UNDER 5 U.S.C. § 552a

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request for information under the Privacy Act , 5 U.S.C. § 552a.

This Request seeks access to: a) any and all records and/or documents that have been prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, USDOJ, or DHS concerning me or my activities; b) The Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB) list for the past five (5) years; and c) the list containing all the agencies, entities, private corporations or individuals with whom you have shared the TSDB during the past five (5) years; and d) provide a copy of the Standard Nomination Form or original information that was used to place my name on the TSDB.

The undersigned also requests that you remove my name and any aliases from any and all “Watchlists” under your agency's control. Should there be a specific procedure to go about the removal of my name from all of the Watchlists, the undersigned requests that you produce the forms, regulations and procedures associated to such request.

The undersigned does not waive my right to appeal any objection to the production of documents listed above under (b) and (c), but agrees to obtain for the time being the page in each of the lists where her name or variations thereof appear. In consideration of the undersigned's compelling interest and need to stop the illegal targeting, derived from inclusion on the TSDB.

When carrying out the search, please do so under all of these names and aliases:

Arvo Zylo
Robert Donald Zylo

To facilitate your search, please note that my social security number is: xx-xxx-9444. Date of birth is 03-30-1981. Place of birth is Chicago, Illinois.

The term “records” and “documents” entails copies thereof regardless of form or format and thus can be interchangeably used to include documents in paper, digital, microfilmed or electronic format; photographs, lists, flowcharts, reports, correspondence, complaints, memoranda, presentations, advisories, emails, or any other tangible form containing information relating to the undersigned in any of the name forms set for the above.

Pursuant to 522(a)(1)(D) items (b) and (c) of the documents requested above should be readily produced inasmuch as they have been requested by the general public more than three times.

Where a document contains information that falls into one or more of the categories described above, I seek the entirety of that document. Please disclose all segregable portions of otherwise exempt records. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).

Since the agency has a duty to make a reasonable effort to search for records in electronic form, I request that responsive electronic records be provided electronically in their native file format. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3)(B). Alternatively, I request that the records be provided electronically in a text-searchable, static-image format (PDF), in the best image quality in the agency’s possession, and in separate, Bates-stamped files.

Should you refuse to produce a record under a statutory privilege or exemption, I ask that you list and describe the document omitted and set forth with specificity the grounds for exempting its production.

In light of the fact that the undersigned has never been accused or convicted of any crimes, if the reason for failing to produce any of the documents and/or information requested herein lies on a pending alleged investigation, you must certify that (a) the statute of limitations for the alleged crime(s) being investigated has not elapsed and (b) that the “ongoing investigation” meets the required standard of “particularized derogatory information and/or a reasonable suspicion” that the undersigned is a “a known or suspected terrorist ('KST')” required to be included in the TSDB.

In tandem with the legal provision that requires your reply to this request within 20 days, I have a compelling need that justifies that you carry out an expedited processing of this request pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). Namely, the urgent need to stop the illegal targeting, resulting from inclusion on the TSDB.

The undersigned expects a determination regarding expedited processing within ten calendar days. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(ii)(I); 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(4).

If the cost of the production of the records sought herein exceeds $50.00, I request you first request my authorization.
I ask that to the extent possible, all replies, correspondence, documents and media be forwarded by means of email.
Please send all correspondence and records relating to this request to email.

If the documents or records cannot be sent by email, you should send them to the mailing address above.
​
In support for my request for expedited processing and pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1746, I declare under penalty of perjury that the foregoing information provided is true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Sincerely,

Arvo Zylo

Arvo Zylo
2519 1st Ave
Seattle, Washington 98121

arvozylo@gmail.com

Re: 2024-HQFO-03143

Dear Requester:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), seeking copies of all information pertaining to you contained in the following systems of records maintained by the CBP and DHS: Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB).

As it relates to your request for information on the TSDB, please be aware that information incorporated from the TSDB and/or WLS is information that is categorized as Sensitive Security Information (“SSI”) under 49 U.S.C. § 114(r), and the implementing regulation found at 49 C.F.R. part 1520. Records containing SSI are not available for public inspection or copying, nor can they be released to anyone who does not have an official need to know under 49 C.F.R. § 1520.9(a)(2) and 1520.15(a).

Moreover, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), the Federal Bureau of Investigation has exempted its system of records containing the TSDB from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including §552a(d), which provides for amendment and access rights. DHS obtains TSDB information from the FBI’s Terrorist Screening Center and the FBI’s exemption carries over when the TSDB information is transferred to the Department. In addition, the Department’s Privacy Act systems of records that are authorized to receive TSDB information via the WLS, see Privacy Impact Assessment for the Watch List Service available at https://www.dhs.gov/publication/dhs-all-pia-027c-watchlist-service-update , are also exempt, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), (k)(1), and/or (k)(2), from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including 5 U.S.C. §552a(d). Accordingly, to the extent records responsive to your Privacy Act request exist, your client has no right to access or amend the records contained in these systems and your Privacy Act request, as amended, is denied.

The Department is required to also process your Privacy Act request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). See 5 U.S.C. § 552a(t)(2)and 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.1. Under FOIA, the Department can neither confirm nor deny the existence of any records that could reveal your client’s status in the TSDB, because either a confirmation or denial that such records exist constitutes SSI, which is protected from release by FOIA exemption 3 (“specifically exempted from disclosure by statute…”), 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3). The applicable exempting statute is 49 U.S.C. § 114(r). Additionally, if any such responsive records existed, they would also be exempt from release under 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(7)(E). Therefore, our FOIA analysis requires no change in our determination under the Privacy Act. 

You have a right to appeal the above determination. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below and refer to 2024-HQFO-03143. You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Regards,

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office
Department of Homeland Security
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
Mail Stop 0655
Washington, DC 20528-0655
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia 

SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: arvozylo@gmail.com Arvo Zylo 2519 1st Ave Apt 708 Seattle, Washington 98121 Re: CISA Case Number 2024-NPFO-00889 Dear Requester: This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), seeking access to: a) any and all records and/or documents that have been prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, USDOJ, or DHS concerning you or your activities; b) The Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB) list for the past five (5) years; and c) the list containing all the agencies, entities, private corporations or individuals with whom we have shared the TSDB during the past five (5) years; and d) provide a copy of the Standard Nomination Form or original information that was used to place your name on the TSDB. As it relates to item “a” of your request, based on the limited information you have provided, we cannot conduct an adequate search. The Department of Homeland Security was created January 24, 2003; therefore, no DHS records exist prior to that date. Records created prior to the establishment of DHS by any of the organizational components of DHS would be maintained by those components. Furthermore, DHS does not maintain a central index of records about individuals. For this reason, the DHS FOIA regulations, at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.3(b) require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search of appropriate systems of records can find them with a reasonable amount of effort. In addition to the information that you provided, this description should include, the type of record you are seeking, the DHS component you believe created and/or controls the records, the precipitating event that you believe warranted the creation of records and the time period that you believe the records or files were created and compiled. If you can provide sufficient additional information as described in this paragraph, we will undertake a search for responsive records. An individual’s request for information pertaining to him or herself is processed under both the FOIA and the PA to afford maximum access to records. Because you have asked for copies of records about yourself, we must verify your identity to ensure that your personal information is not released to anyone other than you or someone you properly designate. The DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.3(a), require verification of your identity, including your full name, current address and date and place of birth. In addition, your request must be made in writing, must contain your signature, and should either be notarized or contain a statement made under penalty of perjury as permitted by 28 U.S.C. 1746. Because you have not provided this documentation, your request is not a proper FOIA/PA request, and we are unable to initiate searching for responsive records. This is not a denial of your request. Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request. Please provide additional information describing the records you are seeking. If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this PA request, and the case will be administratively closed. Additionally, we determined that some of the information you are seeking is not under the purview of DHS. Requests for FBI and USDOJ records, should be made to the FBI and DOJ respectively. In an effort to assist you on this matter, we are providing you with the following contact information: Federal Bureau of Investigation Attn: Initial Processing Operations Unit Record/Information Dissemination Section 200 Constitution Drive Winchester, VA 22602 Submit Online: FBI Records: Freedom of Information/Privacy Acts (FOIPA) For questions about the process please email foipaquestions@fbi.gov Please be aware DOJ is organized into a number of bureaus, divisions, offices, and boards, which are referred to as "components." Within DOJ, each component processes its own records in response to FOIA requests. A list of DOJ FOIA Contacts is available at: Office of Information Policy | Find a FOIA Contact at DOJ | United States Department of Justice. If you believe that DOJ maintains the records you are seeking, but you are uncertain about which component has the records, you may send your request to the Department’s Mail Referral Unit at: FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit Department of Justice Room 115 LOC Building Washington, DC 20530-0001 Phone: (202) 616-3837 E-mail: MRUFOIA.Requests@usdoj.gov Office of Information Policy | Make a FOIA Request to DOJ (justice.gov) Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. As it relates to the remainder of your request regarding information on the TSDB, please be aware that information incorporated from the TSDB and/or WLS is information that is categorized as Sensitive Security Information (“SSI”) under 49 U.S.C. § 114(r), and the implementing regulation found at 49 C.F.R. part 1520. Records containing SSI are not available for public inspection or copying, nor can they be released to anyone who does not have an official need to know under 49 C.F.R. § 1520.9(a)(2) and 1520.15(a). Moreover, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), the Federal Bureau of Investigation has exempted its system of records containing the TSDB from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including §552a(d), which provides for amendment and access rights. DHS obtains TSDB information from the FBI’s Terrorist Screening Center and the FBI’s exemption carries over when the TSDB information is transferred to the Department. In addition, the Department’s Privacy Act systems of records that are authorized to receive TSDB information via the WLS, see Privacy Impact Assessment for the Watch List Service available at https://www.dhs.gov/publication/dhs-all-pia027c-watchlist-service-update , are also exempt, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), (k)(1), and/or (k)(2), from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including 5 U.S.C. §552a(d). Accordingly, to the extent records responsive to your Privacy Act request exist, your client has no right to access or amend the records contained in these systems and your Privacy Act request, as amended, is denied. The Department is required to also process your Privacy Act request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). See 5 U.S.C. § 552a(t)(2)and 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.1. Under FOIA, the Department can neither confirm nor deny the existence of any records that could reveal your client’s status in the TSDB, because either a confirmation or denial that such records exist constitutes SSI, which is protected from release by FOIA exemption 3 (“specifically exempted from disclosure by statute…”), 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3). The applicable exempting statute is 49 U.S.C. § 114(r). Additionally, if any such responsive records existed, they would also be exempt from release under 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(7)(E). Therefore, our FOIA analysis requires no change in our determination under the Privacy Act. You have the right to appeal this determination to neither confirm nor deny the existence of responsive records. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 245 Murray Lane, SW, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 5.8.Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below and refer to 2024-NPFO-00889. You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741- 5769. Regards, DHS FOIA, Privacy Office Department of Homeland Security 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE Mail Stop 0655 Washington, DC 20528-0655 E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Arvo Zylo

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I am replying to the letter (Request No. 1646627-000) I received in response to my attached appeal.  I am in search of any information regarding any and all investigations made about me, for the purposes of rectifying any confusion.  I have been stalked and harassed by a wide array of individuals with seemingly endless resources and infinite knowledge about my personal doings.  They have also taken to slandering me in public.  My internet has been constantly tampered with, and things have been found missing from my home.  I have not committed any crime.  I have no reason to believe that I am, nor have I ever been, a threat to national security.  

If it is not any government organization perpetrating these harmful tactics, then I would like any insight on what organization has been allowed to harass me for so many years.  I have been told that the government outsources to services such as “Infra Guard” and others.  Clearly, I have not been arrested for anything in my adult life, and if I am being harassed daily by a government agency, I'd like to know why I am being denied my right to due process.  If it is not a government agency behind it, I'd like any information on what organization has been allowed to get away with violating my privacy and my rights as an American citizen.  

For ten years, I have had coordinated attempts to harass and intimidate me, up to and including people tampering with my phone, turning its flashlights on randomly through no fault of my own, or making calls without my doing.  I've had my phone ring while it was turned off, in front of witnesses.  I've also had people come up to me in the street and tell me to “be careful what I say in my letters”, not to mention more subtle, but all-too frequent attempts to insinuate that they know intimate details of my personal life.  It may be executed by a wide swath of coordinated individuals, but it is a daily occurrence.  In fact, it is almost every time I go outside. I am hereby giving you as much information as I can in the hopes that you can help me rectify this situation.  

It is my hope that I can uncover information about what organization is harassing me, and if it is in fact due to “investigative” status, I'd like to do what I can to clarify that I have never had any intention to commit any crime whatsoever.   I am frankly not competent enough for terrorism, but I am willing to do what it takes to follow the chain of command and put this harassment to a stop.  

Thanks in advance for your consideration.  I declare under penalty or perjury that the above statements are true to the best of my knowledge and understanding.  

Sincerely,

Arvo Zylo



Hello,

I am writing to appeal DHS's determination that I am not entitled to TSDB documents regarding any investigation that persists against me.  I understand that there are claims that my private information being kept from me may be justified under the auspices of “National Security”, but I would like to know why my right to due process is being violated by a wide array of individuals with seemingly ceaseless access to my personal information and an unending budget that could only be funded by a large organization.   I have not committed any crime, and I've been stalked and harassed for (2014-2024) ten years, not simply “investigated”.  Your email implies that I would have access to specific information that I am not privy to.  I am asking for data on any and all elements of investigation status, or history on me, including actions taken against me.  

Please find my initial request below, followed by the denial letter that I was told to include in my appeal.   I am stating under penalty or perjury that the statements herein are true to the best of my knowledge and understanding.  

Arvo Zylo


RE: PRIVACY ACT REQUEST UNDER 5 U.S.C. § 552a

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request for information under the Privacy Act , 5 U.S.C. § 552a.

This Request seeks access to: a) any and all records and/or documents that have been prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, USDOJ, or DHS concerning me or my activities; b) The Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB) list for the past five (5) years; and c) the list containing all the agencies, entities, private corporations or individuals with whom you have shared the TSDB during the past five (5) years; and d) provide a copy of the Standard Nomination Form or original information that was used to place my name on the TSDB.

The undersigned also requests that you remove my name and any aliases from any and all “Watchlists” under your agency's control. Should there be a specific procedure to go about the removal of my name from all of the Watchlists, the undersigned requests that you produce the forms, regulations and procedures associated to such request.

The undersigned does not waive my right to appeal any objection to the production of documents listed above under (b) and (c), but agrees to obtain for the time being the page in each of the lists where her name or variations thereof appear. In consideration of the undersigned's compelling interest and need to stop the illegal targeting, derived from inclusion on the TSDB.

When carrying out the search, please do so under all of these names and aliases:

Arvo Zylo
Robert Donald Zylo

To facilitate your search, please note that my social security number is: xx-xxx-9444. Date of birth is 03-30-1981. Place of birth is Chicago, Illinois.

The term “records” and “documents” entails copies thereof regardless of form or format and thus can be interchangeably used to include documents in paper, digital, microfilmed or electronic format; photographs, lists, flowcharts, reports, correspondence, complaints, memoranda, presentations, advisories, emails, or any other tangible form containing information relating to the undersigned in any of the name forms set for the above.

Pursuant to 522(a)(1)(D) items (b) and (c) of the documents requested above should be readily produced inasmuch as they have been requested by the general public more than three times.

Where a document contains information that falls into one or more of the categories described above, I seek the entirety of that document. Please disclose all segregable portions of otherwise exempt records. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).

Since the agency has a duty to make a reasonable effort to search for records in electronic form, I request that responsive electronic records be provided electronically in their native file format. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3)(B). Alternatively, I request that the records be provided electronically in a text-searchable, static-image format (PDF), in the best image quality in the agency’s possession, and in separate, Bates-stamped files.

Should you refuse to produce a record under a statutory privilege or exemption, I ask that you list and describe the document omitted and set forth with specificity the grounds for exempting its production.

In light of the fact that the undersigned has never been accused or convicted of any crimes, if the reason for failing to produce any of the documents and/or information requested herein lies on a pending alleged investigation, you must certify that (a) the statute of limitations for the alleged crime(s) being investigated has not elapsed and (b) that the “ongoing investigation” meets the required standard of “particularized derogatory information and/or a reasonable suspicion” that the undersigned is a “a known or suspected terrorist ('KST')” required to be included in the TSDB.

In tandem with the legal provision that requires your reply to this request within 20 days, I have a compelling need that justifies that you carry out an expedited processing of this request pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). Namely, the urgent need to stop the illegal targeting, resulting from inclusion on the TSDB.

The undersigned expects a determination regarding expedited processing within ten calendar days. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(ii)(I); 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(4).

If the cost of the production of the records sought herein exceeds $50.00, I request you first request my authorization.
I ask that to the extent possible, all replies, correspondence, documents and media be forwarded by means of email.
Please send all correspondence and records relating to this request to email.

If the documents or records cannot be sent by email, you should send them to the mailing address above.
​
In support for my request for expedited processing and pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1746, I declare under penalty of perjury that the foregoing information provided is true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Sincerely,

Arvo Zylo

Arvo Zylo
2519 1st Ave
Seattle, Washington 98121

arvozylo@gmail.com

Dear Requester:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), seeking copies of all information pertaining to you contained in the following systems of records maintained by the CBP and DHS: Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB).

As it relates to your request for information on the TSDB, please be aware that information incorporated from the TSDB and/or WLS is information that is categorized as Sensitive Security Information (“SSI”) under 49 U.S.C. § 114(r), and the implementing regulation found at 49 C.F.R. part 1520. Records containing SSI are not available for public inspection or copying, nor can they be released to anyone who does not have an official need to know under 49 C.F.R. § 1520.9(a)(2) and 1520.15(a).

Moreover, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), the Federal Bureau of Investigation has exempted its system of records containing the TSDB from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including §552a(d), which provides for amendment and access rights. DHS obtains TSDB information from the FBI’s Terrorist Screening Center and the FBI’s exemption carries over when the TSDB information is transferred to the Department. In addition, the Department’s Privacy Act systems of records that are authorized to receive TSDB information via the WLS, see Privacy Impact Assessment for the Watch List Service available at https://www.dhs.gov/publication/dhs-all-pia-027c-watchlist-service-update , are also exempt, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), (k)(1), and/or (k)(2), from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including 5 U.S.C. §552a(d). Accordingly, to the extent records responsive to your Privacy Act request exist, your client has no right to access or amend the records contained in these systems and your Privacy Act request, as amended, is denied.

The Department is required to also process your Privacy Act request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). See 5 U.S.C. § 552a(t)(2)and 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.1. Under FOIA, the Department can neither confirm nor deny the existence of any records that could reveal your client’s status in the TSDB, because either a confirmation or denial that such records exist constitutes SSI, which is protected from release by FOIA exemption 3 (“specifically exempted from disclosure by statute…”), 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3). The applicable exempting statute is 49 U.S.C. § 114(r). Additionally, if any such responsive records existed, they would also be exempt from release under 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(7)(E). Therefore, our FOIA analysis requires no change in our determination under the Privacy Act. 

You have a right to appeal the above determination. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below and refer to 2024-HQFO-03143. You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Regards,

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office
Department of Homeland Security
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
Mail Stop 0655
Washington, DC 20528-0655
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia

Re: 2024-HQFO-03143

Dear Requester:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), seeking copies of all information pertaining to you contained in the following systems of records maintained by the CBP and DHS: Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB).

As it relates to your request for information on the TSDB, please be aware that information incorporated from the TSDB and/or WLS is information that is categorized as Sensitive Security Information (“SSI”) under 49 U.S.C. § 114(r), and the implementing regulation found at 49 C.F.R. part 1520. Records containing SSI are not available for public inspection or copying, nor can they be released to anyone who does not have an official need to know under 49 C.F.R. § 1520.9(a)(2) and 1520.15(a).

Moreover, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), the Federal Bureau of Investigation has exempted its system of records containing the TSDB from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including §552a(d), which provides for amendment and access rights. DHS obtains TSDB information from the FBI’s Terrorist Screening Center and the FBI’s exemption carries over when the TSDB information is transferred to the Department. In addition, the Department’s Privacy Act systems of records that are authorized to receive TSDB information via the WLS, see Privacy Impact Assessment for the Watch List Service available at https://www.dhs.gov/publication/dhs-all-pia-027c-watchlist-service-update , are also exempt, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(j)(2), (k)(1), and/or (k)(2), from various provisions of the Privacy Act, including 5 U.S.C. §552a(d). Accordingly, to the extent records responsive to your Privacy Act request exist, your client has no right to access or amend the records contained in these systems and your Privacy Act request, as amended, is denied.

The Department is required to also process your Privacy Act request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). See 5 U.S.C. § 552a(t)(2)and 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.1. Under FOIA, the Department can neither confirm nor deny the existence of any records that could reveal your client’s status in the TSDB, because either a confirmation or denial that such records exist constitutes SSI, which is protected from release by FOIA exemption 3 (“specifically exempted from disclosure by statute…”), 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3). The applicable exempting statute is 49 U.S.C. § 114(r). Additionally, if any such responsive records existed, they would also be exempt from release under 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(7)(E). Therefore, our FOIA analysis requires no change in our determination under the Privacy Act. 

You have a right to appeal the above determination. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below and refer to 2024-HQFO-03143. You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Regards,

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office
Department of Homeland Security
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
Mail Stop 0655
Washington, DC 20528-0655
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia 

SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: arvozylo@gmail.com Arvo Zylo 2519 1st Ave Apt 708 Seattle, Washington 98121 Re: CISA Case Number 2024-NPFO-00889 Dear Requester: This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), seeking access to: a) any and all records and/or documents that have been prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, USDOJ, or DHS concerning you or your activities; b) The Terrorist Screening Database (TSDB) list for the past five (5) years; and c) the list containing all the agencies, entities, private corporations or individuals with whom we have shared the TSDB during the past five (5) years; and d) provide a copy of the Standard Nomination Form or original information that was used to place your name on the TSDB. As it relates to item “a” of your request, based on the limited information you have provided, we cannot conduct an adequate search. The Department of Homeland Security was created January 24, 2003; therefore, no DHS records exist prior to that date. Records created prior to the establishment of DHS by any of the organizational components of DHS would be maintained by those components. Furthermore, DHS does not maintain a central index of records about individuals. For this reason, the DHS FOIA regulations, at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.3(b) require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search of appropriate systems of records can find them with a reasonable amount of effort. In addition to the information that you provided, this description should include, the type of record you are seeking, the DHS component you believe created and/or controls the records, the precipitating event that you believe warranted the creation of records and the time period that you believe the records or files were created and compiled. If you can provide sufficient additional information as described in this paragraph, we will undertake a search for responsive records. An individual’s request for information pertaining to him or herself is processed under both the FOIA and the PA to afford maximum access to records. Because you have asked for copies of records about yourself, we must verify your identity to ensure that your personal information is not released to anyone other than you or someone you properly designate. The DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.3(a), require verification of your identity, including your full name, current address and date and place of birth. In addition, your request must be made in writing, must contain your signature, and should either be notarized or contain a statement made under penalty of perjury as permitted by 28 U.S.C. 1746. Because you have not provided this documentation, your request is not a proper FOIA/PA request, and we are unable to initiate searching for responsive records. This is not a denial of your request. Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request. Please provide additional information describing the records you are seeking. If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this PA request, and the case will be administratively closed. Additionally, we determined that some of the information you are seeking is not under the purview of DHS. Requests for FBI and USDOJ records, should be made to the FBI and DOJ respectively. Within DOJ, each component processes its own records in response to FOIA requests. A list of DOJ FOIA Contacts is available at: Office of Information Policy | Find a FOIA Contact at DOJ | United States Department of Justice. If you believe that DOJ maintains the records you are seeking, but you are uncertain about which component has the records, you may send your request to the Department’s Mail Referral Unit at: FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit Department of Justice Room 115 LOC Building Washington, DC 20530-0001 Phone: (202) 616-3837 E-mail: MRUFOIA.Requests@usdoj.gov Office of Information Policy | Make a FOIA Request to DOJ (justice.gov) Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. Accordingly, to the extent records responsive to your Privacy Act request exist, your client has no right to access or amend the records contained in these systems and your Privacy Act request, as amended, is denied. You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.
